column4: I know this isn't strictly an Ubuntu problem, but does anyone know how to use, say, dd to repair a USB flash drive?  I managed to mess it up so badly it can't read the partition table anymore
you might get some good results with sfdisk
What exactly would I do?  I just want to erase everything on the drive, hopefully make it usable again
oh, you can dd if=/dev/zero of=/dev/device_name_of_your_usb
I think I've found my problem.  sfdisk just crashes whenever I try to do something, saying that my partitions extend past the physical end of the drive
New problem, I can't do anything with the drive, sfdisk crashes saying unrecognized partition table
did you do the dd thing?
now it's telling me there's no partition table whenever I try to do something with it
okay, forget sfdisk then. use fdisk on it and create a partition
I've figured out how to make one, but what sort of table should I make? msdos, aix, etc.?
right, that's what dd did too - totally zero'd out the drive
i'd stick with a fat32 format then - do you have qparted installed?
nevermind, I'll just use msdos partition table type, and see what happens.
ah ok - try 6 fat16 for the partition type :)
Well, I have to use fat32, I'm trying to make a ubuntu bootable usb
